channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Health Canada ignored expert advice to expand access to safe drugs for opioid users, internal documents show
item.description: As deadly drug overdoses climbed across Canada, decision-makers faced political backlash for funding programs that gave drug users prescribed opioids and, against their own experts’ advice, scaled back their support of safe supply programs, an investigation by CBC’s the fifth estate has found.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: As speed cameras are banned in Ontario, Toronto says it needs more funds to cope
item.description: Automated speed enforcement programs in the province officially came to an end after a lightning-fast bill from the Ford government forbade their use on city streets.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Considering sectoral bargaining in Canada

item.title: Gov. Gen. Mary Simon released from hospital, recovery from illness ongoing
item.description: Rideau Hall said Monday that the governor general was in hospital due to a respiratory virus, forcing her to miss Tuesday's Remembrance Day ceremony in Ottawa.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'I'm hoping for a miracle': Breslau, Ont., neighbours on hook for $14K per household for decade-old sewer work
item.description: People living in a Breslau, Ont., neighbourhood received letters this week saying they're expected to pay almost $14,000 per household for sewer and water work done in 2016. Some said they had no idea the bill was coming, while the Township of Woolwich says it should have had better communication with affected property owners.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario skincare company closes store after complaints, allegations it failed to pay rent
item.description: A Waterloo Resveralife store has closed after its lease was terminated, prompting relief from customers who allege years of pressure tactics and unresolved complaints.

item.title: Quebec men accused in alleged extremist plot will go to trial following federal indictment
item.description: Three Quebec men accused of facilitating terrorism will be sent to trial after the federal Crown prosecutor’s office filed a direct indictment on Nov. 7, along with new charges.

item.title: Nova Scotia's first two individual ‘death reviews' slammed for lack of transparency
item.description: One list of recommendations deals with the death of a child at a public pool, and the other is in response to the death of a person in custody.

item.title: How to Speed Up Wheelchair Repairs
item.description: Systemic changes are needed from government and industry, experts say. In the meantime, users are turning to DIY.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Winnipeg couple plead guilty to animal cruelty after killing cats, birds, axolotl for videos they sold
item.description: A Winnipeg couple have pleaded guilty to multiple counts of animal cruelty after being arrested last year for making videos of animals being tortured and killed and selling them on a messaging app — a venture that included more than 90 animals, ranging from kittens to birds to an axolotl.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Five things to know about Quebec graphite mine added to major projects list
item.description: The project includes the company's future open-pit Matawinie Mine in the Lanaudière region, which plans to produce 106,000 tonnes per year of graphite concentrate over 25 years.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadians say they'll spend less, shop earlier for the holidays: BMO
item.description: Tariffs and price concerns were cited as the main reasons Canadians are changing their holiday shopping plans this year.

item.title: Snowy CPL final featuring viral 'icicle kick' exceeds 1 billion views, league says
item.description: The snowy Canadian Premier League final, which featured a blizzard and an audacious bicycle kick, has generated over one billion views, according to a spokesperson from the league.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Car crashes through entrance at Home Hardware in Saskatoon
item.description: Around 1:30 AM Friday, a car swerved off Central Avenue in the Sutherland neighbourhood and blew through the front entrance of a Home Hardware store. By 8:00 a.m., the owner had the place ready to open for business as usual.

item.title: Apartments pitched for Halifax seaside community larger than allowed due to ‘honest error'
item.description: The 64-unit and 22-unit buildings are proposed for Eastern Passage, a community known for its fishing village and waterfront. But there's a 12-unit cap on developments in the area.

item.title: Two arrested, one wanted in homicide and attempted murder investigation: OPP
item.description: Provincial police say two people have been arrested and a third is wanted after linked shootings in Vaughan and Bolton left one man injured and another dead.
